title: "internet connection not working" behind proxy (6.0.0a)
body:
### expected behaviour owncloud instance should be able to access the internet. ### actual behaviour since upgrade from 5.x version to 6.0.0 owncloud has no access to the internet, as indicated by the message on admin page: >internet connection not working >this server has no working internet connection. >... everything was working fine before the upgrade. desktop and web clients work fine. server is behind a proxy that i have no control of. it takes about a minute for the internet check to time out when loading owncloud/index.php/settings/admin ### server configuration operating system: ubuntu 13.10 web server: apache 2.4.6 database: mysql 5.5.34 php version: 5.5.4 owncloud version: 6.0.0a (6.0.0.14) updated from an older owncloud or fresh install: upgraded from the latest 5.0.x version from opensuse repo. list of activated apps: calendar contacts deleted files encryption first run wizard full text search owncloud dependencies info pdf viewer pictures share files tasks text editor updater versions video viewer the content of config/config.php: 
 '[redacted]',
  'passwordsalt' => '[redacted]',
  'datadirectory' => '[redacted]/owncloud/data',
  'dbtype' => 'mysql',
  'version' => '6.0.0.14',
  'dbname' => 'owncloud',
  'dbhost' => 'localhost',
  'dbtableprefix' => 'oc_',
  'dbuser' => '[redacted]',
  'dbpassword' => '[redacted]',
  'installed' => true,
  'proxy' => '[redacted]:8080',
  'theme' => '',
  'maintenance' => false,
  'maxzipinputsize' => 17179869184,
  'allowzipdownload' => true,
  'loglevel' => '1',
  'trashbin_retention_obligation' => 3
);
are you using external storage, if yes which one: no external storage ### client configuration browser: firefox 26 operating system: windows 8.1 64-bit ### logs #### web server error log none applicable. #### owncloud log (data/owncloud.log) >fopen(http://example.com/file.jpg): failed to open stream: connection timed out at /var/www/owncloud/apps/files/ajax/newfile.php#86 #### browser log none applicable
